49  /**
50   * A component that holds all data paths for a single node.
51   */
52  public class NodeEnvironment extends AbstractComponent implements Closeable{
53  
54      /* ${data.paths}/nodes/{node.id} */
55      private final Path[] nodePaths;
56      /* ${data.paths}/nodes/{node.id}/indices */
57      private final Path[] nodeIndicesPaths;
58      private final Lock[] locks;
59  
60      private final int localNodeId;
61      private final AtomicBoolean closed = new AtomicBoolean(false);
62      private final Map<ShardId, InternalShardLock> shardLocks = new HashMap<>();
63  
64      @Inject
65      public NodeEnvironment(Settings settings, Environment environment) throws IOException {
66          super(settings);
67  
68          if (!DiscoveryNode.nodeRequiresLocalStorage(settings)) {
69              nodePaths = null;
70              nodeIndicesPaths = null;
71              locks = null;
72              localNodeId = -1;
73              return;
74          }
75  
76          final Path[] nodePaths = new Path[environment.dataWithClusterFiles().length];
77          final Lock[] locks = new Lock[environment.dataWithClusterFiles().length];
78          int localNodeId = -1;
79          IOException lastException = null;
80          int maxLocalStorageNodes = settings.getAsInt("node.max_local_storage_nodes", 50);
81          for (int possibleLockId = 0; possibleLockId < maxLocalStorageNodes; possibleLockId++) {
82              for (int dirIndex = 0; dirIndex < environment.dataWithClusterFiles().length; dirIndex++) {
83                  Path dir = environment.dataWithClusterFiles()[dirIndex].toPath().resolve(Paths.get("nodes", Integer.toString(possibleLockId)));
84                  if (Files.exists(dir) == false) {
85                      Files.createDirectories(dir);
86                  }
87                  
88                  try (Directory luceneDir = FSDirectory.open(dir, NativeFSLockFactory.INSTANCE)) {
89                      logger.trace("obtaining node lock on {} ...", dir.toAbsolutePath());
90                      Lock tmpLock = luceneDir.makeLock("node.lock");
91                      boolean obtained = tmpLock.obtain();
92                      if (obtained) {
93                          locks[dirIndex] = tmpLock;
94                          nodePaths[dirIndex] = dir;
95                          localNodeId = possibleLockId;
96                      } else {
97                          logger.trace("failed to obtain node lock on {}", dir.toAbsolutePath());
98                          // release all the ones that were obtained up until now
99                          for (int i = 0; i < locks.length; i++) {
100                             if (locks[i] != null) {
101                                 IOUtils.closeWhileHandlingException(locks[i]);
102                             }
103                             locks[i] = null;
104                         }
105                         break;
106                     }
107                 } catch (IOException e) {
108                     logger.trace("failed to obtain node lock on {}", e, dir.toAbsolutePath());
109                     lastException = new IOException("failed to obtain lock on " + dir.toAbsolutePath(), e);
110                     // release all the ones that were obtained up until now
111                     for (int i = 0; i < locks.length; i++) {
112                         IOUtils.closeWhileHandlingException(locks[i]);
113                         locks[i] = null;
114                     }
115                     break;
116                 }
117             }
118             if (locks[0] != null) {
119                 // we found a lock, break
120                 break;
121             }
122         }
123         if (locks[0] == null) {
124             throw new ElasticsearchIllegalStateException("Failed to obtain node lock, is the following location writable?: " + Arrays.toString(environment.dataWithClusterFiles()), lastException);
125         }
126 
127         this.localNodeId = localNodeId;
128         this.locks = locks;
129         this.nodePaths = nodePaths;
130 
131 
132         if (logger.isDebugEnabled()) {
133             logger.debug("using node location [{}], local_node_id [{}]", nodePaths, localNodeId);
134         }
135         if (logger.isTraceEnabled()) {
136             StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("node data locations details:\n");
137             for (Path file : nodePaths) {
138                 sb.append(" -> ").append(file.toAbsolutePath()).append(", free_space [").append(new ByteSizeValue(Files.getFileStore(file).getUnallocatedSpace())).append("], usable_space [").append(new ByteSizeValue(Files.getFileStore(file).getUsableSpace())).append("]\n");
139             }
140             logger.trace(sb.toString());
141         }
142 
143         this.nodeIndicesPaths = new Path[nodePaths.length];
144         for (int i = 0; i < nodePaths.length; i++) {
145             nodeIndicesPaths[i] = nodePaths[i].resolve("indices");
146         }
147     }

151     /**
152      * Deletes a shard data directory iff the shards locks were successfully acquired.
153      *
154      * @param shardId the id of the shard to delete to delete
155      * @throws IOException if an IOException occurs
156      */
157     public void deleteShardDirectorySafe(ShardId shardId) throws IOException {
158         final Path[] paths = shardPaths(shardId);
159         try (Closeable lock = shardLock(shardId)) {
160             IOUtils.rm(paths);
161         }
162     }
163 
164     /**
165      * Deletes an indexes data directory recursively iff all of the indexes
166      * shards locks were successfully acquired. If any of the indexes shard directories can't be locked
167      * non of the shards will be deleted
168      *
169      * @param index the index to delete
170      * @throws Exception if any of the shards data directories can't be locked or deleted
171      */
172     public void deleteIndexDirectorySafe(Index index) throws IOException {
173         final List<ShardLock> locks = lockAllForIndex(index);
174         try {
175             final Path[] indexPaths = new Path[nodeIndicesPaths.length];
176             for (int i = 0; i < indexPaths.length; i++) {
177                 indexPaths[i] = nodeIndicesPaths[i].resolve(index.name());
178             }
179             IOUtils.rm(indexPaths);
180         } finally {
181             IOUtils.closeWhileHandlingException(locks);
182         }
183     }

187     /**
188      * Tries to lock all local shards for the given index. If any of the shard locks can't be acquired
189      * an {@link LockObtainFailedException} is thrown and all previously acquired locks are released.
190      *
191      * @param index the index to lock shards for
192      * @return the {@link ShardLock} instances for this index.
193      * @throws IOException if an IOException occurs.
194      */
195     public List<ShardLock> lockAllForIndex(Index index) throws IOException {
196         Set<ShardId> allShardIds = findAllShardIds(index);
197         List<ShardLock> allLocks = new ArrayList<>();
198         boolean success = false;
199         try {
200             for (ShardId shardId : allShardIds) {
201                 allLocks.add(shardLock(shardId));
202             }
203             success = true;
204         } finally {
205             if (success == false) {
206                 IOUtils.closeWhileHandlingException(allLocks);
207             }
208         }
209         return allLocks;
210     }
211 
212     /**
213      * Tries to lock the given shards ID. A shard lock is required to perform any kind of
214      * write operation on a shards data directory like deleting files, creating a new index writer
215      * or recover from a different shard instance into it. If the shard lock can not be acquired
216      * an {@link LockObtainFailedException} is thrown.
217      *
218      * Note: this method will return immediately if the lock can't be acquired.
219      *
220      * @param id the shard ID to lock
221      * @return the shard lock. Call {@link ShardLock#close()} to release the lock
222      * @throws IOException if an IOException occurs.
223      */
224     public ShardLock shardLock(ShardId id) throws IOException {
225         return shardLock(id, 0);
226     }
227 
228     /**
229      * Tries to lock the given shards ID. A shard lock is required to perform any kind of
230      * write operation on a shards data directory like deleting files, creating a new index writer
231      * or recover from a different shard instance into it. If the shard lock can not be acquired
232      * an {@link org.apache.lucene.store.LockObtainFailedException} is thrown
233      * @param id the shard ID to lock
234      * @param lockTimeoutMS the lock timeout in milliseconds
235      * @return the shard lock. Call {@link ShardLock#close()} to release the lock
236      * @throws IOException if an IOException occurs.
237      */
238     public ShardLock shardLock(final ShardId id, long lockTimeoutMS) throws IOException {
239         final InternalShardLock shardLock;
240         final boolean acquired;
241         synchronized (shardLocks) {
242             if (shardLocks.containsKey(id)) {
243                 shardLock = shardLocks.get(id);
244                 shardLock.incWaitCount();
245                 acquired = false;
246             } else {
247                 shardLock = new InternalShardLock(id);
248                 shardLocks.put(id, shardLock);
249                 acquired = true;
250             }
251         }
252         if (acquired == false) {
253             boolean success = false;
254             try {
255                 shardLock.acquire(lockTimeoutMS);
256                 success = true;
257             } finally {
258                 if (success == false) {
259                     shardLock.decWaitCount();
260                 }
261             }
262         }
263         return new ShardLock(id) { // new instance prevents double closing
264             @Override
265             protected void closeInternal() {
266                 shardLock.release();
267             }
268         };
269     }
270 
271     /**
272      * Returns all currently lock shards
273      */
274     public Set<ShardId> lockedShards() {
275         synchronized (shardLocks) {
276             ImmutableSet.Builder<ShardId> builder = ImmutableSet.builder();
277             return builder.addAll(shardLocks.keySet()).build();
278         }
279     }
280 
281     private final class InternalShardLock {
282         /*
283          * This class holds a mutex for exclusive access and timeout / wait semantics
284          * and a reference count to cleanup the shard lock instance form the internal data
285          * structure if nobody is waiting for it. the wait count is guarded by the same lock
286          * that is used to mutate the map holding the shard locks to ensure exclusive access
287          */
288         private final Semaphore mutex = new Semaphore(1);
289         private int waitCount = 1; // guarded by shardLocks
290         private ShardId shardId;
291 
292         InternalShardLock(ShardId id) {
293             shardId = id;
294             mutex.acquireUninterruptibly();
295         }
296 
297         protected void release() {
298             mutex.release();
299             decWaitCount();
300         }
301 
302         void incWaitCount() {
303             synchronized (shardLocks) {
304                 assert waitCount > 0 : "waitCount is " + waitCount + " but should be > 0";
305                 waitCount++;
306             }
307         }
308 
309         private void decWaitCount() {
310             synchronized (shardLocks) {
311                 assert waitCount > 0 : "waitCount is " + waitCount + " but should be > 0";
312                 if (--waitCount == 0) {
313                     InternalShardLock remove = shardLocks.remove(shardId);
314                     assert remove != null : "Removed lock was null";
315                 }
316             }
317         }
318 
319         void acquire(long timeoutInMillis) throws LockObtainFailedException{
320             try {
321                 if (mutex.tryAcquire(timeoutInMillis, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS) == false) {
322                     throw new LockObtainFailedException("Can't lock shard " + shardId + ", timed out after " + timeoutInMillis + "ms");
323                 }
324             } catch (InterruptedException e) {
325                 Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
326                 throw new LockObtainFailedException("Can't lock shard " + shardId + ", interrupted", e);
327             }
328         }
329     }
330 
331     public int localNodeId() {
332         return this.localNodeId;
333     }

335     public boolean hasNodeFile() {
336         return nodePaths != null && locks != null;
337     }

339     /**
340      * Returns an array of all of the nodes data locations.
341      * @throws org.elasticsearch.ElasticsearchIllegalStateException if the node is not configured to store local locations
342      */
343     public Path[] nodeDataPaths() {
344         assert assertEnvIsLocked();
345         if (nodePaths == null || locks == null) {
346             throw new ElasticsearchIllegalStateException("node is not configured to store local location");
347         }
348         return nodePaths;
349     }

378     /**
379      * Returns all data paths for the given index.
380      */
381     public Path[] indexPaths(Index index) {
382         assert assertEnvIsLocked();
383         Path[] indexPaths = new Path[nodeIndicesPaths.length];
384         for (int i = 0; i < nodeIndicesPaths.length; i++) {
385             indexPaths[i] = nodeIndicesPaths[i].resolve(index.name());
386         }
387         return indexPaths;
388     }
389 
390     /**
391      * Returns all data paths for the given shards ID
392      */
393     public Path[] shardPaths(ShardId shardId) {
394         assert assertEnvIsLocked();
395         final Path[] nodePaths = nodeDataPaths();
396         final Path[] shardLocations = new Path[nodePaths.length];
397         for (int i = 0; i < nodePaths.length; i++) {
398             shardLocations[i] = nodePaths[i].resolve(Paths.get("indices", shardId.index().name(), Integer.toString(shardId.id())));
399         }
400         return shardLocations;
401     }
402 
403     public Set<String> findAllIndices() throws Exception {
404         if (nodePaths == null || locks == null) {
405             throw new ElasticsearchIllegalStateException("node is not configured to store local location");
406         }
407         assert assertEnvIsLocked();
408         Set<String> indices = Sets.newHashSet();
409         for (Path indicesLocation : nodeIndicesPaths) {
410 
411             if (Files.exists(indicesLocation) && Files.isDirectory(indicesLocation)) {
412                 try (DirectoryStream<Path> stream = Files.newDirectoryStream(indicesLocation)) {
413                     for (Path index : stream) {
414                         if (Files.isDirectory(index)) {
415                             indices.add(index.getFileName().toString());
416                         }
417                     }
418                 }
419             }
420         }
421         return indices;
422     }
423 
424     /**
425      * Tries to find all allocated shards for the given index or for all indices iff the given index is <code>null</code>
426      * on the current node. NOTE: This methods is prone to race-conditions on the filesystem layer since it might not
427      * see directories created concurrently or while it's traversing.
428      * @param index the index to filter shards for or <code>null</code> if all shards for all indices should be listed
429      * @return a set of shard IDs
430      * @throws IOException if an IOException occurs
431      */
432     public Set<ShardId> findAllShardIds(@Nullable final Index index) throws IOException {
433         if (nodePaths == null || locks == null) {
434             throw new ElasticsearchIllegalStateException("node is not configured to store local location");
435         }
436         assert assertEnvIsLocked();
437         return findAllShardIds(index == null ? null : index.getName(), nodeIndicesPaths);
438     }
439 
440     private static Set<ShardId> findAllShardIds(@Nullable final String index, Path... locations) throws IOException {
441         final Set<ShardId> shardIds = Sets.newHashSet();
442         for (final Path location : locations) {
443             if (Files.exists(location) && Files.isDirectory(location)) {
444                 try (DirectoryStream<Path> indexStream = Files.newDirectoryStream(location)) {
445                     for (Path indexPath : indexStream) {
446                         if (index == null || index.equals(indexPath.getFileName().toString())) {
447                             shardIds.addAll(findAllShardsForIndex(indexPath));
448                         }
449                     }
450                 }
451             }
452         }
453         return shardIds;
454     }
455 
456     private static Set<ShardId> findAllShardsForIndex(Path indexPath) throws IOException {
457         Set<ShardId> shardIds = new HashSet<>();
458         if (Files.exists(indexPath) && Files.isDirectory(indexPath)) {
459             try (DirectoryStream<Path> stream = Files.newDirectoryStream(indexPath)) {
460                 String currentIndex = indexPath.getFileName().toString();
461                 for (Path shardPath : stream) {
462                     if (Files.exists(shardPath) && Files.isDirectory(shardPath)) {
463                         Integer shardId = Ints.tryParse(shardPath.getFileName().toString());
464                         if (shardId != null) {
465                             shardIds.add(new ShardId(currentIndex, shardId));
466                         }
467                     }
468                 }
469             }
470         }
471         return shardIds;
472     }
473 
474     /**
475      * Tries to find all allocated shards for all indices iff the given index on the current node. NOTE: This methods
476      * is prone to race-conditions on the filesystem layer since it might not see directories created concurrently or
477      * while it's traversing.
478      *
479      * @return a set of shard IDs
480      * @throws IOException if an IOException occurs
481      */
482     public Set<ShardId> findAllShardIds() throws IOException {
483         return findAllShardIds(null);
484     }
485 
486     public void close() {
487         if (closed.compareAndSet(false, true) && locks != null) {
488             for (Lock lock : locks) {
489                 try {
490                     logger.trace("releasing lock [{}]", lock);
491                     lock.close();
492                 } catch (IOException e) {
493                     logger.trace("failed to release lock [{}]", e, lock);
494                 }
495             }
496         }
497     }
498 
499 
500     private boolean assertEnvIsLocked() {
501         if (!closed.get() && locks != null) {
502             for (Lock lock : locks) {
503                 try {
504                     assert lock.isLocked() : "Lock: " + lock + "is not locked";
505                 } catch (IOException e) {
506                     logger.warn("lock assertion failed", e);
507                     return false;
508                 }
509             }
510         }
511         return true;
512     }
513 
514     /**
515      * This method tries to write an empty file and moves it using an atomic move operation.
516      * This method throws an {@link ElasticsearchIllegalStateException} if this operation is
517      * not supported by the filesystem. This test is executed on each of the data directories.
518      * This method cleans up all files even in the case of an error.
519      */
520     public void ensureAtomicMoveSupported() throws IOException {
521         final Path[] nodePaths = nodeDataPaths();
522         for (Path directory : nodePaths) {
523             assert Files.isDirectory(directory) : directory + " is not a directory";
524             final Path src = directory.resolve("__es__.tmp");
525             Files.createFile(src);
526             final Path target = directory.resolve("__es__.final");
527             try {
528                 Files.move(src, target, StandardCopyOption.ATOMIC_MOVE);
529             } catch (AtomicMoveNotSupportedException ex) {
530                 throw new ElasticsearchIllegalStateException("atomic_move is not supported by the filesystem on path [" + directory + "] atomic_move is required for elasticsearch to work correctly.", ex);
531             } finally {
532                 Files.deleteIfExists(src);
533                 Files.deleteIfExists(target);
534             }
535         }
536     }

542      * @param files the files to get paths for
543      */
544     @Deprecated // this is only a transition API
545     private static File[] toFiles(Path... files) {
546         File[] paths = new File[files.length];
547         for (int i = 0; i < files.length; i++) {
548             paths[i] = files[i].toFile();
549         }
550         return paths;
551     }
